title: Shenandoah National Park: Volunteer
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer             Volunteer         Volunteers-in-Parks   Learn new skills! Gain work experience! Meet new people! Explore your national park! Join the community of volunteers nationwide who donate their time and talent to our national parks. Being part of Volunteer-in-Parks is a fun and rewarding way to contribute to these wonderful places.  Volunteer opportunities abound at Shenandoah! Here are some ways you can help:  Be a campground host Perform maintenance and clean-up Provide information along hiking trails and at visitor centers Collect natural and cultural resources data Remove exotic plants Restore native plant communities Be an Artist-In-Residence and more!  Most volunteer opportunities run April through November, but some are available throughout the year. There are opportunities for individuals as well as groups; they can be long term or one-day events. For more information, e-mail the Park's Volunteer Coordinator.         Volunteers pull invasive plants in Shenandoah   Getting Started Check out our list of Current Volunteer Opportunities below and apply directly (or sign up for one-day events listed). You may also download an application and mail it to: Shenandoah National Park Volunteer & Youth Programs Coordinator 3655 U.S. Hwy 211 East Luray, VA 22835-4702   Help Our Trails Shenandoah National Park has more than 500 miles of hiking trails, including 101 miles of the Appalachian National Scenic Trail. The Potomac Appalachian Trail Club (PATC) partners with Shenandoah to keep Park trails well maintained and safe. If you are interested in trail work, look at current PATC Volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest in Shenandoah National Park. We look forward to hearing from you!       Current Volunteer Opportunities
